intro: Eurypetalum unijugum, commonly known as the single-juged bellflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically blue or violet, with a unique structure that includes a single jugate (two-part) lower lip. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
